Parameters: String: string representing a set of permissions
Throws: if the string cannot be converted to a set of permissions
fromString(java.lang.String).Description: Returns the set of permissions corresponding to a given String representation. The perms parameter is a String representing the permissions. It has 9 characters that are interpreted as three sets of three. The first set refers to the owner's permissions; the next to the group permissions and the last to others. Within each set, the first character is 'r' to indicate permission to read, the second character is 'w' to indicate permission to write, and the third character is 'x' for execute permission. Where a permission is not set then the corresponding character is set to '-'.

Returns: an attribute encapsulating the given file permissions with @B_java#nio#file#attribute#FileAttribute#name_E@ "posix:permissions"
Throws: if the set contains elements that are not of type PosixFilePermission
asFileAttribute(java.util.Set<java.nio.f.Description: Creates a @B_java#nio#file#attribute#FileAttribute_E@, encapsulating a copy of the given file permissions, suitable for passing to the @B_java#nio#file#Files#createFile_E@ or @B_java#nio#file#Files#createDirectory_E@ methods.

Returns: the string representation of the permission set
toString(java.util.Set<java.nio.file.att.Description: Returns the String representation of a set of permissions. It is guaranteed that the returned String can be parsed by the @B_java#nio#file#attribute#PosixFilePermissions#fromString_E@ method. If the set contains null or elements that are not of type PosixFilePermission then these elements are ignored.

ClassDesc: This class consists exclusively of static methods that operate on sets of @B_java#nio#file#attribute#PosixFilePermission_E@ objects.
